meanings.definition: Each of the two or more projecting pointed parts at the end of a fork.
meanings.sent1: The fork had three prongs for picking up food.
meanings.sent2: She carefully balanced the meat on the prong of the fork.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used a prong to fling acorns at the birds.
meanings.sent4: His words were like prongs, piercing through her defenses.
meanings.sent5: The prongs of the fork gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The rake's prong got stuck in the pile of leaves.
meanings.sent2: He used a prong to hold the fabric in place while sewing.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully batted at the prong of the rake.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a prong of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The prong of the anchor dug deep into the sand.
